com.friendlyreminder.application.person

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.friendlyreminder.application.person.UserController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(path="/users")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    controller class that handles displaying all views for a logged-in user controller handles requests to add/update/delete ContactBooks,Contacts, CommunicationEvents, and SortingStrategys

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserController(UserRepository userRepository, ContactBookRepository contactBookRepository, ContactRepository contactRepository, CommunicationEventRepository communicationEventRepository)

public java.lang.String addContactBook()
        controller method to display new ContactBook creation page

      • addContactBookToUser

        @PostMapping(path="/addBook.do")
public java.lang.String addContactBookToUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,
                                                                              org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                              org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                              @RequestParam
                                                                              java.lang.String contactBookName)
        method that performs actual creation of new ContactBook
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        contactBookName - name of created contactbook, passed as POST request param
        Returns:
        filename of view to display (if still logged in, displays User home page else landing page)

        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        contactBookId - unique id of contact book to update contact in
        importance - relative importance value of the contact
        contactFirstName - new first name of contact
        contactLastName - new last name of contact
        contactNotes - new notes for contact
        contactPhoneNumber - new phonenumber for contact
        contactEmailAddress - new emailaddress for contact
        contactId - contact to update

        @GetMapping(path="/deleteContact")
public java.lang.String deleteBook(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,
                                                                      org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                      org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                      @RequestParam
                                                                      java.lang.Integer contactBookId,
                                                                      @RequestParam
                                                                      java.lang.Integer contactId)
        method to delete to contact from specified contactbook
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        contactBookId - contactbook to delete from
        contactId - contact to delete
        Returns:
        filename of view to display (if logged in it will be contactBook view page otherwise landing page)

      • changeEventSort

        @GetMapping(path="/openContact/changeSort")
public java.lang.String changeEventSort(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,
                                                                                    org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                    org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                    @RequestParam
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer contactId,
                                                                                    @RequestParam
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer contactBookId,
                                                                                    @RequestParam
                                                                                    CommunicationEventSortingStrategy sortingStrategy)
        method to change sortingStrategy for events in specified contact
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        contactId - unique id of contact to change strategy for
        contactBookId - book to return to if goback option is selected
        sortingStrategy - new strategy (CommunicationEventSortingStrategy
        Returns:
        filename of view to display (if logged in, we display contact view page else we display landing page)

public java.lang.String addEvent(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,

                                                               java.lang.Integer contactId,
                                                               @RequestParam

        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view

      • addEventToContact

        @PostMapping(path="/addEvent.do")
public java.lang.String addEventToContact(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,
                                                                            org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                            org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                            @RequestParam
                                                                            java.lang.Integer contactId,
                                                                            @RequestParam
                                                                            java.lang.Integer contactBookId,
                                                                            @RequestParam(name="eventDate")
                                                                            java.lang.String date,
                                                                            @RequestParam
                                                                            java.lang.String eventType,
                                                                            @RequestParam
                                                                            java.lang.String eventNotes)
        method that handles POST request to actually add new communication event to given contact
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        contactId - id of contact to add event to
        contactBookId - id of contact book this contact belongs to
        date - parameter (passed from form) that designates which date this occurred on
        eventType - parameter (passed from form) that designates type of contact (enum CommunicationType
        eventNotes - parameter (passed from form) that is notes related to this event, designated by user
        Returns:
        filename of view to display after transaction completed (landing if not logged in, contact view page if successful)

      • deleteEvent

        @GetMapping(path="/deleteEvent")
public java.lang.String deleteEvent(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession,
                                                                     org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                     org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                     @RequestParam
                                                                     java.lang.Integer eventId,
                                                                     @RequestParam
                                                                     java.lang.Integer contactId,
                                                                     @RequestParam
                                                                     java.lang.Integer contactBookId)
        method that completes GET request to delete a communication event from a contact
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - contains attributes used by controller in redirect scenario
        httpSession - session that will contain login status as attribute
        model - model object with model attributes used in displaying view
        eventId - unique id of event to delete
        contactId - unique id of contact to delete event from
        contactBookId - unique id of book this contact belongs to
        Returns:
        filename of view for controller to display

      • getAllUsers

        @GetMapping(path="/all")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.Iterable<User> getAllUsers()
        UserController method to display all registered users (and their nested contact books, contacts, events)
        Returns:
        JSON response to be displayed by browser that contains all registered users and their data
